intro: Villarsia lasiosperma, commonly known as the woolly sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with numerous small, fleshy leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is often found in coastal and inland sandy habitats.
